info.name: Automated Tests | OfficeX REST API
info.description:
REST API docs for [OfficeX](https://officex.app)

View full docs at [https://dev.officex.app](https://dev.officex.app)

exec: // Check if the response is successful and contains the drive_id
// Log an error if the request was not successful
console.error("Failed to retrieve drive_id. Status code: " + pm.response.code);
// Check if the response is successful and contains the drive_id
// Log an error if the request was not successful
console.error("Failed to retrieve gift_card_id. Status code: " + pm.response.code);
// Log an error if the request was not successful
console.error("Failed to retrieve redeem_code or org_id or ServerEndpoint. Status code: " + pm.response.code);
// Log an error if the request was not successful
console.error("Failed to retrieve auth_token. Status code: " + pm.response.code);

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 200ms", function () {
pm.test("Validate the structure of the 'ok' object in the response", function () {
pm.test("DRIVE_ID, CANISTER_ID, VERSION, and OWNER_ID are non-empty strings", function () {
pm.test("Validate APIKEYS_BY_VALUE_HASHTABLE and APIKEYS_BY_ID_HASHTABLE are objects containing expected key-value pairs", function () {
// Check if APIKEYS_BY_VALUE_HASHTABLE has at least one key-value pair
pm.expect(Object.keys(apiKeysByValue)).to.have.lengthOf.at.least(1, "APIKEYS_BY_VALUE_HASHTABLE should contain at least one key-value pair");
// Check if APIKEYS_BY_ID_HASHTABLE has at least one key-value pair
pm.expect(Object.keys(apiKeysById)).to.have.lengthOf.at.least(1, "APIKEYS_BY_ID_HASHTABLE should contain at least one key-value pair");
pm.test("Response time is less than 200ms", function () {
pm.test("Response schema matches expected structure", function () {
pm.test("Each item in the 'items' array contains the required fields", function () {
pm.test("Total is a non-negative integer indicating the total number of items", function () {
